title: Medical Language Education Based on Clinical Pathway Simulation for Wound Assessment and Management

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and nursing processes, fundamental concepts of wound management, and basic medical language skills for clinical documentation
context.additional_context: Offline interactive instruction using personal devices (tablets/laptops). Focuses on training medical terminology usage and linguistic expression for documenting patient records and explaining medical conditions.

learning_goals: Learners analyze 15 wound case types and use professional terminology to make appropriate clinical algorithm judgments with 85%+ accuracy.
Learners use professional terminology describing wound conditions (infection/necrosis/moisture level) to select appropriate dressing products with 90%+ accuracy.

Over a 2-week intermediate course, learners use online clinical pathway simulation tools (e.g., SimX, Shadow Health), receive 3+ peer feedback sessions, complete 2+ 1:1 instructor coaching sessions, achieve 80%+ on simulation performance rubrics, and use accurate professional terminology in medical record documentation.

resources: Access to Interactive Clinical Pathway Web Platform
Wound Care Textbooks and Standard Protocol Documents

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
